feature.label: Design Space Explorer
feature.description:
Design Space Explorer (DSE) generates instance models from declarative models. OSATE does this too, but requires implementations all the way down.
AADL allows subcomponents to be types, that may have several implementations. However, AADL will not generate an instance model needed for many analysis tools, and especially, verification condition generation by the BLESS Proof Tool.
DSE provides a checkbox tree so a user can select which implementations are desired when subcomponents are types.
These configurations can be saved and recalled so the user doesn't need to check boxes every time DSE is used.
In addition, when a property set contains *only* property constants having aadlinteger type, DSE will allow you to change them. This was included especially for component and port array sizes to allow different parts of the system to have different levels of redundancy for fault tolerance tradeoff analysis.
